abstract.t: This document specifies an Extension to BCP 47 which provides subtags that specify language and/or locale-based behavior or refinements to language tags, according to work done by the Unicode Consortium.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: provides extensions identified by a single-character subtag for "the generation of identifiers that contain a language component and are compatible with applications that understand language tags". This document defines such an extension, using the letter 'u', to specify Unicode language/locale identifiers.

section.title: Requirements Language
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119.

section.title: BCP47 Required Information
section.t: Language tags, as defined by , are useful for identifying the language of content. They are also used as locale identifiers (or can be mapped to locales) in many operating environments and APIs. However, most such locale identifiers also provide additional "tailorings" or options for specific values within a language, culture, or other regional variation. This extension provides a mechanism for using these additional tailorings within language tags for general interchange.
The maintaining authority for this extension's registry is the Unicode Consortium. Unicode defines common locale data and identifiers for this data:

texttable.c: Unicode Technical Standard #35 Unicode Locale Data Markup Language (LDML), http://unicode.org/reports/tr35/

section.t: The specification of extension subtags is provided by Unicode Technical Standard #35 Unicode Locale Data Markup Language, Section 3.2 BCP 47 Tag Conversion. defines the formation of subtags which follow the language tag ABNF and other rules for the formation of language tags and subtags as defined in . In particular, it specifies that subtags are restricted to the ASCII letters and digits, that case is not significant, and that subtags MUST NOT exceed eight characters in length.

specifies a canonical representation. LDML is available over the Internet and at no cost, and is available via a royalty-free license at http://unicode.org/copyright.html. LDML is versioned, and each version of LDML is numbered, dated, and stable. Extension subtags, once defined by LDML, are never retracted or change in meaning in a substantial way. LDML will include in a separate section the registration form in .

section.title: Summary
section.t: defines the subtags within the 'u' extension as a series of key-value pairs. Each key has a length of two characters, and each value has a length of three or more characters. Each key is followed by zero or one value. Case is not significant. The canonical case is lowercase; the canonical order of the keys is alphabetical.

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t: This document will require IANA to insert the record in into the Language Extensions Registry, according to Section 3.7. Extensions and the Extensions Registry of "Tags for Identifying Languages" in BCP 47. There might be occasional maintenance of this record. This document does not require IANA to create or maintain a new registry or otherwise impact IANA.
